channel.title: PSP2 Announcement
channel.description:
- TWO ANALOG STICKS - six access motion controls - new game media (flash based carts) - big big screeen - and a touch pad on the back - Front and rear camera, with a microphone - 5 inch OLED - 3G plus WiFI - GPOS - 4x resolution of PSP - Touch screen - Touch pad on back of device - PS3 quality graphics - Released this holiday season, in Japan
Some games - Killzone - Little Big Planet - Reality Fighters - Uncharted - WipeOut - Resistance

item.title: PSP2 Announcement
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
I had a DS. First run production model, second to last one in the store.

I sold it this year. I owned a grand total of nine games for it. Three of which I played for any serious stretch of time. But hey, The World Ends With You was awesome. It pushed the DS to it’s technical extremes and had good music. And having played many other games on the system, it’s really hard to get decent audio on the DS, unless you made Sonic Rush.

Read full topic

item.title: PSP2 Announcement
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
xalener:

That’s not so much the problem as the console having a shortage of titles that aren’t fucking party games.

On a limited income, there are plenty of games that interest me that I’ll play on the Wii that aren’t party games.

The oversaturation of shovelware is a problem though. I just don’t purchase those. We all know that Nintendo’s systems thrive on first party support anyways, and Nintendo generally comes through with the excellent titles. Makes owning a Nintendo system worth owning.

Read full topic

item.title: PSP2 Announcement
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
Maxx Skywalker:

I think the major appeal of the PSone came from the young demographic clamoring for anything with blood in it. As this trend continues today, when you still hear people complaining that Nintendo’s systems don’t have enough ‘M’ in them.

That’s not so much the problem as the console having a shortage of titles that aren’t fucking party games.

Read full topic

item.title: PSP2 Announcement
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
Bro the PSX had good games no matter you saying.

You obviously played the wrong games. As far as I can tell, the only things the N64 really had graphically over the PSX were texture smoothing and actually showing you the part of the model that is supposed to be there. (based on my experience and doing no actual research) The latter bugged me about the PSX, but not enough to make me unwilling to play the system.

Read full topic

item.title: PSP2 Announcement

item.description:
Maxx Skywalker:

Just about the only games worth playing on the system are the Final Fantasy titles, and even then, that’s questionable at best.

You’re kidding.

Read full topic

item.title: PSP2 Announcement
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
Eh, PSone games weren’t really that great. The Nintendo 64 had far better games for that generation. I can’t even go back and play some PSone games because I can’t get over how horrid 32 bit really is, and I’m not a graphics gamer by any means. Just about the only games worth playing on the system are the Final Fantasy titles, and even then, that’s questionable at best.

Maverix26:

^Epic sig, my friend.

Totally irrelevant to the subject matter at hand, but thank you.

Read full topic
